instruction: Patient states prior stomach issues occurred with sertraline but have not been experienced with current fluoxetine therapy. Since the recent dose adjustment, mood has remained stable even during a hectic period at work; patient does not feel overwhelmed. Reports full adherence to fluoxetine, taking it every morning without missed doses.

attributes.narrative: Patient previously experienced stomach issues on sertraline but reports none on current fluoxetine therapy. Since the recent fluoxetine dose adjustment, mood remains stable despite a hectic work period, and the patient does not feel overwhelmed. Patient reports full adherence, taking fluoxetine every morning with no missed doses.

instruction: Fluoxetine – patient currently taking once daily every morning; adherent with no missed doses and no gastrointestinal side-effects reported.
Major depressive disorder, single episode, unspecified (ICD-10 F32.9) – condition assessed as stable on current fluoxetine regimen; patient reports improved tolerance and stable mood.

attributes.background: The patient reports stable mood and improved medication tolerance; the provider assessed the disorder as stable on the current fluoxetine regimen.
attributes.narrative: Major depressive disorder appears stable with continued benefit from fluoxetine; no medication changes required at this time.
